data.title: Automatically open containing folder when opening a file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Win 10

If I open a file by simply double click it, then the folder containing it will not be considered my workspace. Consequently, the configure file of some extensions for this folder does not work.

For example, I use spell check extension and add some ignore words to it. If I do not open folder, then the ignore words list does not work.

Do I have any method to open VS Code with folder mode as a default way, by simply double click the file?

data.title: Navigation/Goto Anywhere
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600

Actually I think it's  not issues. I just want to know.
Does vscode have any feature to navigate/go to function like keyboard shortcut CTRL + R in Sublime. 
I am web developer ,  I already tried by using keyboard shortcut CTRL + SHIFT + O, CTRL + T, but it's not working, it can't navigate.

data.title: Fix Markdown Paragraph Colorization Terminating Early for Multiline Paragraphs
data.body: For issue #11906 **Bug** For markdown like this: ``` `a` `b` `c` *d* `e` `f` *g* ``` No content after `b` on the second line is properly colorized. I believe this is because in the text mate grammar, the `while` of the paragraph matching regular expression terminates too soon **Fix** In the `while`, inside the negative lookahead that checks for headers or lists, add a condition so that the negative look ahead only applies when the element being looked for is on a new line **Testing** Tried out a few markdown files and colorization generally seems to be improved. Ran the colorization test scripts and the markdown one was still passing. Here's an example I was using to test a few edge cases: ``` `a` `b` `c` *d* `e` `f` *g* `h` `i` *j* `h` `i` *j* # h1 `h` `h` `i` *j* `h` `i` *j* 1. a 2. b 3. c `a` `b` `c` *d* `e` `f` *g* `h` `i` *j* `h` `i` *j* ``` Before change: After change:

data.title: When switching between 2 files, position continually shifts down

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. have at least 2 files open (C#) in a project
2. switch to the other file, and then back
3. each time you do this, the file position will shift down one or more lines when the # references appear

data.title: Block cursor doesn't match parenthesis correctly.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: 10.10.5

A picture says a thousand words:

![screen shot 2016-09-19 at 5 53 57 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167745/18653922/38291c8e-7e92-11e6-86ff-cbf94912b977.png)

data.title: Artifacts in UI after Code is open for a little while

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14915

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Sorry, no specific steps to repro

After having VS Code open for a while, editing multiple tabs, etc., sometimes the UI will become corrupted as in the following screenshot, and every action taken (moving the cursor, switching tabs, typing, resizing the window, etc.) causes the black squares and unrendered text in the window to move around).

The amount of time VS Code is open before corruption can occur, or number of tabs opened before corruption occurs seems random. I've seen this start when as few as 1 tab (or even a lot of tabs) are open, or if it has been running for as little as a couple minutes, up to many hours.

The only workaround seems to be to restart VS Code which is a pain especially because it doesn't have an automatic session restore like Notepad++ does.

I've been encountering this issue periodically since Insiders 1.3 or so but I've been trying to get some kind of reliable repro before reporting -- but I've been unable to do so, so I'm reporting it now.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/494055/18653633/009c6eda-7e90-11e6-8ad1-2e57646397ea.png)

data.title: Remove simpleMarkedWorker.ts
data.body: This markdown rendering worker script is not used as far as I can tell. I see no references to `markdownToHtml` in the codebase. This change removes it.

data.title: Fix colorization of html prefixed by spaces in markdown files
data.body: Issue #12289 **Bug** Html tags prefixed by 1 to 4 spaces are not colorized properly in markdown files **Fix** Consume optional leading whitespace when matching html tags instead of only starting from previous match location closes #12289

data.title: HTML in Markdown Prefixed by Spaces is not Colorized
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 - OS Version: OSX ##### Steps to Reproduce: Create markdown file with the following content in VSCode: ```

text

``` Note the spaces before the `

` tag ##### Expected The inline html should be colorized in the editor ##### Actual After adding between one and four spaces in front of the `

` tag, the html is no longer colorized.

data.title: Mac flipped cursor on standard dpi monitors is blurry

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Insiders
- OS Version: macOS El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use a standard dpi monitor (not Retina display)
2. Hover over a line number
3. Note that the cursor is blurry.

This is because our version of this cursor isn't precisely pixel-aligned to alias gracefully, see the multiple lines of banding below.

Will update this with a revised asset soon.

![screen shot 2016-09-19 at 2 43 01 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11839736/18650515/5503d37a-7e7a-11e6-982e-83918a0e9005.png)

data.title: Option to change default behavior of cursorHome and cursorEnd

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently (1) `cursorHome` command moves to the first non-whitespace character on the current line, and (2) `cursorEnd` moves to the last non-whitespace character on the current line.

I would like if there was an option that would disable behavior (1) and always move cursor to column 1 (i.e., the actual beginning of the line). This same option could change behavior (2) and always move cursor to end of current line past all whitespace, if any (i.e., the actual end of the line).

data.title: Error when Updating/Installing Extension: Response doesn't appear to be JSON
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 64bit
1. When I open VScode, it shows me that I have 3 outdated extensions. 
2. I go into the extensions panel and click on "Update" button.
3. I get the error: Response doesn't appear to be JSON
   ![screenshot_402](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12707785/18648746/00a1d2c2-7e8a-11e6-9680-ffd52f9eb814.png)

What does this mean? How can I fix it?
I am behind a proxy, but it doesnt seem to be the problem because I am able to browse the available extensions, and VScode can successfully connect to tell me which one's are outdated.

Thanks,
David

data.title: Feature request: Sort NuGet package versions in descending order
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows and Ubuntu, at least :)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. While editing `project.json` for a .NET project, start adding a dependency to an existing NuGet package
2. When about to enter a version number, hit ctrl+space to bring up a list of versions

It would be much more helpful if that list of versions was sorted in _descending_ order, so that it's easy to find the latest version of the package.

data.title: Feature Request: Open new file buffer via API
html document unchanged running on mamp server and in app database
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: El Capitan 10.11.6

Was using a local host mamp server to do development and using the in app database for a login page. After making changes to the login page, saving and refreshing the browser there are no changes made on the screen However, putting the same changes in any other editor seems to show the changes made while still running on mamp. This was all working on a production database and seems to have stopped once I added the mamp database to a connection file.
Steps to Reproduce:
1. type any proper html/angular
2. save
3. refresh page
4. no changes to the displayed document

data.title: Extensions are becoming dissociated with themselves
data.body:
- VSCode Version:  1.6.0-Insiders and 1.5.2 Stable
- OS Version: Windows 10

I have been seeing some sort of issue for a while, but finally had time to take a better look into it. I have been seeing that some extensions I know are out of date, but they aren't registering as out of date when I check in Code. It shows the Extension is installed, but when I do a search for it, it does not think the extension is installed and gives me the option of installing it.

Below you can see where it shows the Extension **VSCode Great Icons** as being installed and offers the Uninstall option when looking under installed Extensions.

![greaticonsinstalled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6662208/18644646/ca99eab2-7e6f-11e6-9861-0e4156aa4bae.png)

However, if I do a search for the same extension, you can see if the screenshot below that it shows up as not being installed.

![greaticons](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6662208/18644620/abbf1144-7e6f-11e6-97a2-7e877217436f.png)

I have 3 outdated Extensions, but these do not show up in Code as outdated. You can see in the above screenshot that we know that extension is installed and outdated.

![greaticonsoutdated](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6662208/18644782/42ee5dd6-7e70-11e6-83a8-e8f62d243ce0.png)

I then started checking all of my extensions to see if others were not properly displaying in VSCode, but were up to date. In total, I have 40 Extensions installed, and here are my results from checking each one. On the right I show their folder fullname with version and on the left their display name and version in Code.
## Show as Installed: 20
- AdamCaviness.theme-monokai-dark-soda-0.0.5    - Monokai Dark Soda 0.0.5
- akamud.vscode-theme-onedark-0.2.6             - One Dark Theme 0.2.6
- anseki.vscode-color-0.1.11                    - Color Picker 0.1.11
- bbenoist.vagrant-0.4.0                        - Vagrant 0.4.0
- be5invis.vscode-icontheme-nomo-dark-1.1.1     - Nomo Dark Icon Theme 1.1.1
- codezombiech.gitignore-0.2.0                  - gitignore 0.2.0
- dbankier.vscode-instant-markdown-0.1.0        - Instant Markdown 0.1.0
- DotJoshJohnson.xml-1.6.0                      - XML Tools 1.6.0
- gerane.Theme-ant-0.0.3                        - ant Theme 0.0.3
- gerane.Theme-monokai-inverse                  - monokai-inverse Theme 0.0.2
- Kasik96.theme-monokaiclear-0.0.1              - Monokai Clear 0.0.1
- Pendrica.Chef-0.6.1                           - Chef Extension for VSCode 0.6.1
- PKief.material-icon-theme-1.0.3               - Material Icon Theme 1.0.3
- qinjia.seti-icons-0.0.9                       - seti-icons 0.0.9
- robertohuertasm.vscode-icons-2.0.5            - vscode-icons 2.0.5
- seanmcbreen.MDTools-1.0.0                     - MDTools 1.0.0
- tht13.python-0.2.3                            - Python for VSCode 0.2.3              -Remove
- TsumiNa.Seti-theme-0.0.1                      - Seti-Theme 0.0.1
- vip32bit.theme-monokai-black-0.1.0            - theme-monokai-black 0.1.0
- zhuangtongfa.Material-theme-1.0.3             - Material-theme 1.0.3
## Show as Missing: 20
- DavidAnson.vscode-markdownlint-0.5.0         - markdownlint 0.5.0
- donjayamanne.githistory-0.0.8                - Git History (git log) 0.0.11
- DougFinke.vscode-pandoc-0.0.8                - vscode-pandoc 0.0.8
- EditorConfig.EditorConfig-0.3.1              - EditorConfig for VS Code 0.3.1
- emilast.LogFileHighlighter-0.9.0             - Log File Highlighter 0.9.0
- emmanuelbeziat.vscode-great-icons-1.0.9      - VSCode Great Icons 1.1.6
- gerane.Theme-CarbonightBlue-0.0.2            - CarbonightBlue Theme 0.0.2
- gerane.Theme-FlatlandBlack-0.0.2             - Flatland_Black Theme 0.0.2
- gerane.Theme-FlatlandDark-0.0.2              - Flatland_Black Theme 0.0.2
- gerane.Theme-FlatlandMonokai-0.0.4           - Flatland Monokai Theme 0.0.4
- gerane.Theme-Zenburn-0.0.3                   - Zenburn Theme 0.0.3
- gerane.TodoTXT                               - TodoTXT 0.0.1
- MattiasPernhult.vscode-todo-0.8.0            - vscode-todo 0.8.0
- minhthai.vscode-todo-parser-1.8.1            - TODO Parser
- ms-vscode.csharp-1.4.1                       - C# 1.4.1
- ms-vscode.PowerShell-0.7.2                   - PowerShell 0.7.2
- ms-vscode.Theme-MarkdownKit-0.1.1            - Markdown Theme Kit 0.1.1
- ms-vscode.Theme-MaterialKit-0.1.1            - Material Theme Kit 0.1.1
- naumovs.color-highlight-1.2.1                - Color Highlight 1.2.1
- rebornix.Ruby-0.5.6                          - Ruby 0.6.0
## Outdated and Missing

Of the 20 Extensions showing as missing, these 3 are out of date.
- donjayamanne.githistory-0.0.8                - Git History (git log) 0.0.11
- emmanuelbeziat.vscode-great-icons-1.0.9      - VSCode Great Icons 1.1.6
- rebornix.Ruby-0.5.6                          - Ruby 0.6.0

My worry here is that if any of my other extensions get out of date, they too will have the same issue as the 3 above. Is there anything else I can do to try to debug this? The only Error I have been seeing in the Debug tools is the following:

```
"Failed to clear temp storage: It was determined that certain files are unsafe for access within a Web application, or that too many calls are being made on file resources. SecurityError"
```

The problem with that error is it doesn't happen all the time and sometimes seems to happen a little while after Code has been started up.

If I check my extensions in the Stable version of Code, I am seeing similar results.

data.title: window.showTextDocument Performance Problems
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Show a text document
2. With that document still in focus, attempt to call showTextDocument with the document object.

window.showTextDocument seems to have performance problems (1-1.5 second promise resolve) when calling it with a document that is already in focus.

Calling showTextDocument on a document that is open but not in focus for one of the editor windows does not show this performance problem.

Edit: Clarification: This seems to be a performance problem specifically for the promise resolving. You can visually see the window come into focus in a reasonable amount of time, but the promise resolving with the editor object is greatly delayed.

data.title: Add Syntax Highlighting for C# Fenced Code Blocks in Markdown Files
data.body:
Adds c# to the list of language highlighted in markdown fenced code blocks. You must have a c# language extension install for this to work.

![screen shot 2016-09-19 at 11 55 44 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18644905/ff847bb2-7e5f-11e6-9652-d7bafef4e42a.png)

Closes #7003

data.title: Backslash incorrectly escapes single quote in MSSQL language
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.2 (66f37fd2a99eb9d628dd374d81d78835b410c39b, 2016-09-12T13:30:03.456Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new .sql file
2. Add a line similar to SELECT \* from MyTable WHERE Value = 'C:\path\to\file\' AND 1 = 1
3. The trailing backslash is incorrectly escapes the ending single quote, resulting in the rest of the line being displayed as quoted text

Screen capture of incorrect behaviour in VS Code
![vscodescreencap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13856906/18643700/397629f6-7e74-11e6-9875-6aac27c12726.PNG)

Screen capture of correct behaviour in SQL Server Management Studio
![ssmsscreencap](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13856906/18643701/3977a556-7e74-11e6-913b-87d762fa7466.PNG)

data.title: Request: vim-like scroll - like scrollLineUp/scrollLineDown, except keep cursor in view
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 7

I like `scrollLineUp` and `scrollLineDown` but I would like to keep the cursor in the current view as shown in this animation.

![vim_scroll](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22036935/18642828/73e65cec-7e5f-11e6-850d-85897389ca88.gif)

In other words, the way `ctrl+e` and `ctrl+y` behave in vim.

data.title: Ability to auto detect encoding when opening a file which is not encoded in UTF-8
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 1607 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a file which is not encoded in UTF-8(etc, contains Chinese characters, encoded in GBK)
2. the Chinese characters are not displayed correctly.
3. Reopen with encoding, and choose Chinese(GBK), the Chinese characters are displayed correctly.

I hope VSCode can auto detect the file encoding when opening, and open with the correct encoding, not need to reopen with correct encoding manually.

Thank you.

data.title: [feature request] Add support for SymbolKind.AnonymousMethod (or SymbolKind.UnnamedMethod, SymbolKind.Lambda?)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: `Version 1.6.0-insider (1.6.0-insider)` de7267dc4e521aa7ef4187fd6b9c98570beea540
- OS Version: `OS X El Capitan Version 10.11.6 (15G1004)`

I think it would be great if there was a `SymbolKind` for anonymous (i.e. unnamed) methods/functions etc. This would allow for extension (especially CodeLensProviders) to differentiate between the different method types. For example, in my extension [GitLens](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=eamodio.gitlens) I ideally don't want to render CodeLens for unnamed methods.

Notice that the highlighted text has not populated the find box like it does in editor windows.
